title: ICICI Lombard launches surety insurance for infra sector
points: Launch of: Surety Insurance
Launched by: ICICI Lombard
Reason: To provide risk mitigation solutions for India’s burgeoning infrastructure sector.
What is Surety insurance?
It acts as a guarantee to a beneficiary (typically an authority or client) that a principal debtor (usually a contractor) will fulfil their contractual obligations.
If the contractor fails to honour the terms or contractual commitments, the surety insurance provider will provide financial compensation to the beneficiary.

title: SBI launches web-based digital business loans solution for MSMEs’ invoice financing
points: Launch of: MSME -Sahaj
Launched by: State Bank of India (SBI)
MSME -Sahaj:
A web-based digital business loans solution for MSMEs’ (micro, small and medium enterprises) invoice financing.
The Bank’s customers can avail finance against their Goods and Service Tax (GST) registered sales invoices of up to ₹1 lakh in less than 15 minutes.
Aim: To provide “on tap” short-term credit for working capital needs to MSME units who are part of the GST regime.

title: Bank of Baroda receives ₹1,068 crore demand order from IT Dept
points: Bank: Bank of Baroda
Notice received: ₹1,068 crore demand order from IT Dept
Year: Assessment Year (AY) 2017-18
Received a demand order under section 156 of the Income Tax Act, 1961.

title: RBI joins ‘Project Nexus’ to enable instant cross-border retail payments
points: Name of Project: Project Nexus
Joined by: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI)
Aim: To enable instant cross-border retail payments by interlinking domestic Fast Payments Systems (FPSs)
What is Project Nexus?
It was conceptualized by the Innovation Hub of the Bank for International Settlements (BIS)
Aim: To connect the FPSs of four ASEAN countries (Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand); and India

An agreement to this effect was signed by the BIS and the Central Banks of the founding countries -- Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM), Bank of Thailand (BOT), Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), and RBI on June 30, 2024, in Basel, Switzerland.
The platform is expected to go live by 2026.

title: ADB & Aadhar housing partners to give housing loans to low-income women
points: Signed between: Asian Development Bank (ADB) and Aadhar Housing Finance Limited (AHFL)
Amount: USD 60 million nonconvertible debentures financing agreement
Reason: To provide housing loans to women and address the shortage of financing in the low-income and affordable housing segment in India.
Half of the funds will be deployed in Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal.
AHFL is a housing finance company in India focused on the low-income housing segment, with loan sizes under 1.5 million Indian rupees (around USD 17,976).

title: Home loan outstanding grew by 3.4 lakh crore in last one year: RBI
points: Report by: The Reserva Bank of India (RBI)
Credit growth for housing loans: Accelerated by 16.9% to reach Rs 23.49 lakh crore, up from Rs 20.09 lakh crore a year earlier, marking a 13.8% growth
The growth in home loan was up by 13.8% with a total of Rs 20.09 lakh crore in May 2024 as compared to last year.
Growth rate of personal loans: Decreased to 17.8% year-on-year in May 2024, down from 19.1% compared to the previous year.
Credit card outstanding in May this year increased by 26.2% to about Rs 55,000 crore, reaching Rs 2.67 lakh crore.
On a year-on-year basis, non-food bank credit rose by 16.2% to Rs 162.30 lakh crore in May 2024, compared to a growth of 15.5% in the previous year.

title: Union Bank of India Introduces “Union Premier” Branches
points: Launch of: “Union Premier” Branches
Launched by: Union Bank
Target area: Rural and Semi-Urban Markets
Offer: Personalized banking with dedicated Relationship Managers, advanced digital solutions
MD and CEO of Union Bank of India: A.Manimekhalai

title: Bank of Maharashtra launches VKYC for remote account opening
points: Launch of: Video Based Customer Identification Process (V-KYC)
Launched by: Bank of Maharashtra
Target area: For remote account opening
Aim: To allow customers to open savings account from any remote place, eliminating the need for branch visits and paperwork

title: GST collection at Rs 1.74 trillion in June 2024
points: GST collection June 2024: Rs 1.74 trillion
7.7 per cent year-on-year (YoY) growth
Notably less than the 12.4% and 10% increases recorded in April and May, respectively.
April 2024 witnessed a record-high GST collection of Rs 2.1 trillion.
The GST taxpayer base increased to 14.6 million in April 2024
Note: The finance ministry has now decided to discontinue the publication of detailed tax collection numbers.

title: World Bank Approves 1.5 Billion Dollars To Accelerate Development Of Low-Carbon Energy
points: Amount of loan: 1.5 Billion Dollars
Receiver: India
Approved by: World Bank
Reason: To accelerate the development of low-carbon energy
Phase: Second phase
The financing is extended to promote a market for green hydrogen, electrolysers, and increased renewable energy penetration.
The development comes in the backdrop of India’s ambitious National Green Hydrogen Mission and energy transition targets.
The Centre has set a target of achieving 500 GW of installed renewable energy capacity by 2030 and reaching net zero by 2070.

title: CBIC initiates electronic disbursal of duty drawback amount
points: Launched of: Electronically disburse duty drawback amount
Launched by: Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC)
The payment of duty drawback amounts into the exporters' accounts will be facilitated through the Public Finance Management System (PFMS) automatically.
This is another initiative of the CBIC towards paperless Customs and enhanced trade facilitation.
This new functionality is expected to reduce time taken for payment of drawback amount by eliminating manual intervention in the drawback disbursal mechanism and increase transparency.

title: GAIL fast-tracks net zero carbon goal to 2035 from 2040
points: GAIL (India) Ltd has revised its target to achieve net zero carbon emissions to 2035 from 2040.
GAIL Board accorded approval to advance its net zero target for Scope-I and 2 emissions by five years.
Scope 1: Emissions from sources that an organisation owns or controls directly. For example, from burning fuel in factories or even in its fleet of vehicles.
Scope 2: Emissions that a company causes indirectly and that come from the energy it purchases and uses. For example, the emissions caused by generating electricity.
GAIL chairman and managing director Sandeep Kumar Gupta

title: Mospi sets up 26-member committee to decide new base year for GDP
points: Ministry: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (Mospi)
Members: 26-member Advisory Committee
Recommendation on: National Accounts Statistics (ACNAS) to decide the base year for gross domestic product (GDP) data.
Chairman: Biswanath Goldar, former professor of the Institute of Economic Growth

Other members of the committee include GC Manna, former director general, central statistics office (CSO), professor Mausami Das, Delhi School of Economics, and Chetan Ghate, director, Institute of Economic Growth.
The committee will have a tenure of five years or till the completion of next base year, whichever is later.

title: Indian Navy Joins World’s Largest Naval Exercise RIMPAC
points: Exercise Name: Rim of the Pacific Exercise (RIMPAC) 2024
This exercise is the world’s biggest international maritime warfare exercise
Location: Hawaii
Total nation: 29
Indian Navy participation: The Indian Navy has deployed frontline warship INS Shivalik for the RIMPAC.
The harbour phase of the exercise is taking place from June 27 to July 7.
The RIMPAC exercise will run till August 1.
The theme of RIMPAC 2024 is 'Partners: Integrated and Prepared.'

title: SEBEX 2, India’s New Explosive Revolutionizing Military Firepower
points: India has introduced SEBEX 2, a highperformance explosive with a TNT equivalence of 2.01.
Developed under the Make in India initiative by Economic Explosives Limited
SEBEX 2 enhances the effectiveness of various munitions without increasing weight.
Certified by the Indian Navy, SEBEX 2, SITBEX 1 and SIMEX 4 demonstrate India's growing capabilities in military technology.
This offers significant export potential and enhances global security efforts.

title: Bangladesh Navy Signs Contract For ‘Made In India’ 800 Tons Ocean Going Tug With India’s GRSE
points: Bangladesh Navy signed a contract for ‘Made in India’ 800 tons Ocean Going Tug with India’s Garden Reach Shipbuilding and Engineers.
The signing coincides with the visit of India’s Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi to Bangladesh.

title: Itanagar Woman Police Station Awarded With ISO 9001:2015 Certification
points: The Woman Police Station, Itanagar, has been awarded with ISO 9001:2015 certification
This was informed by the Superintendent of Police, Itanagar, Rohit Rajbir Singh.
This recognition highlights the station’s commitment to dealing humanely and effectively with crimes against women and children.
The ISO 9001:2015 certification is an international standard that signifies the implementation of a comprehensive quality management system.

title: TN to promote Madurai, Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli, Virudhunagar as ‘Space Bay'
points: The Tamil Nadu government is promoting the nearby districts of Madurai, Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli, and Virudhunagar as “Space Bay.”
It plans to offer additional incentives to companies to accelerate development, according to Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation (TIDCO).
Note: The Kulasekarapattinam spaceport will be ready in two years to launch small satellites

title: Jharkhand Cabinet approves financial assistance scheme for 45 lakh women
points: Name of Scheme: Mukhya Mantri Bahan Beti Maiqui Swabalamban Protsahan Yojana
Launched by: Jharkhand government
Beneficiary: 45 lakh women
Aim: To empower and make them self-reliant
Each woman will receive Rs 1,000 per month
The state government will bear Rs 5,500 crore annually for this initiative
The scheme is applicable to women between 21 and 50 years of age.
Income tax payees, government employees, EPF holders, and a few other categories are excluded from the scheme’s benefits

title: National Doctor’s Day 2024
points: Date: July 1
The day was established to commemorate the birth and death anniversary of Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, a renowned physician and the second Chief Minister of West Bengal.
The Government of India officially recognized this day in 1991.

title: National Chartered Accountant (CA) Day 2024
points: CA Day is observed on July 1st every year.
In 2024, it is marking the 76th anniversary of the founding of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI).

title: Ravi Agrawal Appointed CBDT Chief, Succeeds Nitin Gupta
points: Ravi Agrawal, a 1988-batch IRS officer, has been appointed as the new chairman of the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT).
He succeeds Nitin Gupta, whose tenure ended on June 30, 2024.
Agrawal’s appointment extends till June 2025, with a reappointment on a contract basis to ensure continuity in CBDT’s policy framework.

title: LIC Chairman Siddhartha Mohanty redesignated managing director & CEO
points: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has re-designated its chairman Siddhartha Mohanty as managing director (MD) and chief executive officer (CEO), with effect from June 30, 2024.

title: RBI appoints Arnab Kumar Chowdhury, Charulatha S Kar as executive directors
points: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced the appointment of Arnab Kumar Chowdhury and Charulatha S Kar as executive directors.
Chowdhury and Kar will look after three departments each.
Kar has been appointed as Executive Director (ED) with effect from July 1 while Chowdhury has been appointed ED with effect from June 3, 2024.

title: Veteran Sri Lankan Tamil leader Sampanthan passes away
points: R Sampanthan, a veteran Sri Lankan politician and a moderate Tamil leader, who relentlessly pursued a life of peace, justice and dignity for Tamil nationals in the island nation, passed away

title: Japan's H3 Rocket Launches ALOS-4 Satellite
points: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) launched the ALOS-4 Earth observation satellite aboard the H3 rocket.
JAXA confirmed post-launch that the mission was successful.
The H3 mission took off from the Tanegashima Space Center.
The satellite separated from the launch vehicle approximately 16 minutes and 34 seconds into the mission.
This was the second successful mission for the H3 rocket.

title: George Wins the Austrian Grand Prix
points: Mercedes’ George Russell won the Austrian Grand Prix, the 11th round of the 2024 Formula 1 world championship, after Max Verstappen and Lando Norris collided.

title: Bank Credit Growth Of 15.4% For FY25: India Ratings
points: Agency: India Ratings
Forecast: Loan growth of 15.4 per cent for Indian banks in FY25
As of May 31, 2024:
The credit growth of the banking system (excluding the merger of HDFC Ltd with HDFC Bank) was 16.1% year-on-year.
Including the impact of the HDFC merger, the banking system's credit growth stood at 19.8%
Deposit growth continued to lag behind credit growth at 15.3%.

title: Sebi proposes mandatory disclosure of riskadjusted returns for mutual funds
points: Proposal: Mandatory disclosure of riskadjusted returns for mutual funds
Proposed by: SEBI
Aim: To help investors make informed investment decisions and also to limit the scope for mis-selling

Risk-adjusted return (RAR): Represents a more holistic measure of the scheme's performance as it quantifies the amount of return generated by a mutual fund scheme for each unit of risk taken to achieve that return.
To bring uniformity across different funds, Sebi has also proposed a methodology for the calculation of the information ratio for different categories of mutual fund schemes.

title: IBBI introduces digital forms for monitoring liquidation processes
points: Agency: Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
Launched: A set of electronic forms under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code
The new circular introduces forms LIQ 1 to LIQ 4, covering different stages of the liquidation process.
Present process: The IPs submit the details regarding the liquidation process, to the board through emails, which is time-consuming and inefficient
Aim: To ease the compliance burden for insolvency professionals
These forms are crucial for the liquidation process under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).
Systematic and transparent record-keeping
Different stages of LIQ 1 to LIQ 4:
LIQ 1: Details from the commencement of liquidation to the public announcement
LIQ 2: Information from the public announcement to the progress report, including valuation, sale, and receipts
LIQ 3: Focuses on the period from the last progress report to the application for dissolution
LIQ 4: Deals with the distribution of proceeds and other final details post-dissolution order

title: ICICI Prudential and HDFC Life get GST notices
points: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance: GST notice of Rs. 365 crore, including interest. Demanded GST along with applicable interest and penalty for the fiscal years 2017-18 to 2022-23 for all GST-registered states.

HDFC Life Insurance: GST notice of Rs. 132 crore, with interest to be applied as applicable. The alleged violations include the wrongful deduction of amounts towards GST from commissions paid to insurance agents, which should have been deposited with the government.

title: RBI launches 'Finquiry' to allow fintechs directly engage with the regulator
points: Launch of: Finquiry
Launched by: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI)
Aim: To allow fintechs directly engage with the regulator
An exclusive 2 hours window called 'Finquiry' for fintechs to visit the FinTech department of the RBI in Mumbai.
RBI has opened the window from 26th June
This will be available on the last working Wednesday of every month from 3 to 5pm.
For inquiries and scheduling appointment, fintech representatives can reach out via email cgmfintech@rbi.org.in.

title: HDFC Life's 'Bridge the Gap' initiative to enhance life insurance awareness
points: Launch of: Bridge the Gap
Launched by: HDFC Life
Aim: To elevate public awareness about life insurance.
HDFC Life has been actively promoting National Insurance Awareness Day, celebrated on 28th June, through various campaigns.
Life insurance penetration in India is strikingly low at only 3.2%, with a substantial protection gap of about 91%.
This effort supports the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India’s (IRDAI) goal of achieving ‘Insurance for All’ by 2047.

title: Japan To Launch New Banknotes On July 3
points: Japan will start issuing new banknotes on the 3rd of July 2024.
It is the world’s first use of cutting-edge holography that makes the portraits of historic figures appear to rotate in 3D, as per the reports.
This new technology will allow visually impaired people to feel and discern which banknote they are holding.
Tactile marks for the visually impaired will also make them recognizable to touch.
Note: Existing banknotes will remain valid after the introduction of the new banknotes.

title: Indian High Commission Launched ‘One Tree4Mother’ Campaign In Bangladesh
points: Launch of: ‘One Tree4Mother’ Campaign
Launched by: Indian High Commission
Launched in: Bangladesh
Campaign inspired by Prime Narendra Narendra Modi who launched the ‘Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam’ Campaign on World Environment Day 2024 in New Delhi.
High Commissioner of India to Bangladesh: Pranay Verma

title: Titan To Set Up Tanishq’s Factory In Bangladesh
points: Titan has decided to set up a factory in Narayanganj, near Dhaka, Bangaldesh.
Joint venture with a local enterprise named Rhythm Group
Reason of JV: To manufacture and market products in Bangladesh for its flagship jewellery brand Tanishq
They plan to open five Tanishq jewellery outlets in Dhaka shortly after establishing the manufacturing facility in the economic zone

title: MoSPI Launches eSankhyiki Portal
points: Launch of: eSankhyiki Portal
Launched by: Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI)
Reason: For integrated development of the national statistical system in the country in tune with the global statistical practices and data dissemination standards
It will provide real-time inputs for planners, policy-makers, researchers and the public at large.
Aim: To establish a comprehensive data management and sharing system for ease of dissemination of official statistics in the country

title: EPFO gross new members addition dips 4% to 10.9 mn in 2023-24: MoSPI report
points: Report title: 'Payroll Reporting in India: An Employment Perspective January to April, 2024'
Report by: Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation
Findings:
EPFO's gross new subscribers addition declined by over 4% to 10.9 million in 2023-24 compared to a year ago
EPFO recorded 10,993,119 gross addition of new members in 2023-24 compared to 11,498,453 in 2022-23.

title: Govt to launch campaign for redressal of family pensioners' grievances
points: Launch of: Redressal of family pensioners' grievances campaign
Launched by: Union Minister of State for Personnel Jitendra Singh
Data: Presently, around 90,000 cases are being registered on an online Centralised Pension Grievance and Redress System (CPENGRAMS) in a year.

The Department of Pension and Pensioners' Welfare (DOPPW), as part of its 100 days action plan will be undertaking a month-long special campaign for effective redressal of family pensioners' grievances during the period July 1-31, 2024 in which 46 ministries/departments will be participating.

The grievances can be registered either directly or on the portal --www.pgportal.gov.in/PENSION/ by the applicant or by DOPPW on receipt of details through e-mail, post or toll-free number 1800-11-1960.

title: New portal to expedite agri infra fund interest subsidy claims of farmers
points: Launch of: Web portal and Krishi Katha
Launched by: Union minister for agriculture and farmers’ welfare Shivraj Singh Chouhan
Web Portal:
Aim: Faster bank settlements of interest subsidy claims under the Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
Developed by: Department of Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare (DA&FW) and the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (Nabard)
Automated system will help in calculating accurate eligible interest subvention through the portal.
Avoid possible human error in manual processing
About AIF scheme:
Launched in: 2020

Objective: To develope post-harvest management infrastructure to reduce losses, realise better value for farmers, foster innovation in agriculture, and attract investments for agricultural infrastructure.
Total outlay: Rs 1 trillion funding through banks and financial institutions up to 2025-26
3 per cent interest subsidy to beneficiaries for loans given by banks of up to Rs 2 crore for a maximum period of 7 years.
Krishi Katha:
A blog to serve as a digital platform to showcase the voices of Indian farmers.
It is dedicated to amplifying the experiences, insights, and success stories of farmers across the country

title: Thales Inks Pact With Adani Defence To Manufacture 70mm Rockets In India
points: Signed between: Adani Defence & Aerospace and Thales Group
Contract: To manufacture 70mm rockets locally
This strategic collaboration aligns with the Indian government’s “Make in India” initiative, aiming to enhance self-reliance in defence production.

Thales Group is a French multinational company that designs, develops and manufactures electrical systems as well as devices and equipment for the aerospace, defence, transportation and security sectors.

title: Karnataka Based Udupi Cochin Shipyard Ltd Bags Order Worth 1100 Crore Rupees From Norwegian Company
points: Karnataka based Udupi Cochin Shipyard Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of Cochin Shipyard Ltd, has bagged an order worth 1100 crore rupees from a Norwegian company for the design and construction of eight dry cargo vessels.

Each vessel, with 100 meters length, will have a deadweight of 6300 metric tonnes. It will be an environment friendly diesel-electric vessel, and will be utlised for the transport of general cargo in the coastal waters of Europe.
As per the agreement, the order should be executed within September 2028.

title: Bangladesh Navy Signs Contract For ‘Made In India’ 800 Tons Ocean Going Tug With India’s GRSE
points: Bangladesh Navy signed a contract for ‘Made in India’ 800 tons Ocean Going Tug with India’s Garden Reach Shipbuilding and Engineers.
The signing coincides with the visit of India’s Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi to Bangladesh.

title: NFSU And Haryana Govt. Sign An MoU To Establish A Centre Of Excellence In Panchkula
points: An MoU for setting up the Centre of Excellence for matters related to identified crime cases was signed between National Forensic Science University (NFSU) and Haryana Government at Panchkula, Haryana.
A 50-acre campus will be built in Panchkula, Haryana in collaboration with NFSU.
It will be the country’s first Center of Excellence which will be built in the state.

title: Uttar Pradesh to Establish Rs 2000 Crore Bioplastic Park
points: Uttar Pradesh’s government, led by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, has made it official that a bioplastic park will be built in the Lakhimpur Kheri area.
The idea comes about because more and more people are worried about how plastics made from petroleum hurt the environment.
The park is in Kumbhi village, Gola Gokarnnath tehsil, and covers 1000 hectares.
It will be developed quickly with an investment of around Rs 2 billion.

title: International Day of Parliamentarism 2024 Observed on June 30th
points: In 2024, the focus is on “Parliamentary diplomacy: Building bridges for peace and understanding.”
This theme emphasizes how parliamentarians can contribute to international cooperation and conflict resolution.

title: International Day of the Tropics 2024
points: The International Day of the Tropics, observed annually on June 29, is a day dedicated to recognizing the incredible diversity and importance of the world's tropical regions.

title: International Asteroid Day 2024 is Observed on 30th June
points: International Asteroid Day is observed on June 30th each year.
It aims to increase public awareness about the potential dangers of asteroids and other near-Earth objects (NEOs).
The United Nations officially recognized this day in December 2016.

title: National Statistics Day 2024
points: National Statistics Day is celebrated in India every year on June 29th.
This day honors the birth anniversary of Professor Prasanta Chandra Mahalanobis, a renowned statistician and economist.
For the 18th National Statistics Day in 2024, the theme is “Use of data for decisionmaking”.

title: General Upendra Dwivedi Takes Charge As Indian Army
points: General Upendra Dwivedi has taken over as the Chief of the Army Staff (COAS) from General Manoj Pande, who took charge in May 2022.

title: Sujata Saunik becomes first woman to be appointed as Maharashtra chief secretary
points: Senior IAS officer Sujata Saunik on Sunday took over as Maharashtra's Chief Secretary, becoming the first woman in the state's 64- year-old history to occupy the top post.

title: CS Setty gets FSIB approval to head SBI as next chairman
points: Challa Sreenivasulu Setty has been selected as the next chairman of the State Bank of India (SBI) by the Financial Services Institution Bureau (FSIB).
Setty, who has worked at SBI for 35 years, will succeed current chairman Dinesh Khara, who will end his term on August 28.

title: PM Modi Releases Three Books On Life And Journey Of Former VP Venkaiah Naidu
points: Prime Minister Narendra Modi released three books on the life and journey of former Vice President M. Venkaiah Naidu on the eve of his 75th birthday via video conferencing

title: SpaceX Wins $843-Million NASA Contract to Destroy the International Space Station
points: NASA has awarded SpaceX an $843 million contract to construct a spacecraft aimed at safely deorbiting the International Space Station (ISS) by around 2030.
While SpaceX will build the vehicle, NASA will oversee its operation and take ownership of the craft once completed.
The ISS will smash into our planet’s atmosphere at a speed of more than 17,000 mph (27,500 km/h) before landing in a crashdown spot in the ocean.
The floating laboratory’s first parts were launched in 1998, and it has been occupied by astronauts from the U.S., Japan, Russia, Canada and Europe since 2000.
Weighing approximately 430,000 kilograms (950,000 pounds)

title: BCCI announces Rs 125 crore prize money for Indian team for T20 WC triumph
points: T20 2024 winner: India
Defeated: South Africa
Defeated by: 7 runs
Location: Bridgetown, Barbados  BCCI secretary Jay Shah announced a prize money of Rs 125 crore for the Indian team

title: Global Chess League to Hold Second Edition in London in October
points: The highly anticipated second edition of Tech Mahindra Global Chess League will take place in London, England from 3rd to 12th October 2024.
It will take place at Friends House in central London.
